poem:
Title: "On Judicial Deferment"

In the court of Judge Aileen,
No summer verdict will be seen.
"Unworkable," she decries
Under the weight of July skies.
Trump's folio of concealed knowledge,
Labeled illicit by the college,
Yet the trial dance is not set,
In the legal silhouette.
Percolating with debate,
Time alone declares the fate.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Judge in Trump documents case not convinced by prosecutors’ plea for July trial date A federal judge overseeing Donald Trump’s criminal case over his retention of classified documents appeared inclined to reject a proposal by special-counsel prosecutors that she set a schedule culminating in a July trial, saying at a court hearing on Friday she found the timeline unworkable. The US district judge Aileen Cannon, a Trump appointee, did not set a new trial date". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Judge in Trump documents case not convinced by prosecutors’ plea for July trial date A federal judge overseeing Donald Trump’s criminal case over his retention of classified documents appeared inclined to reject a proposal by special-counsel prosecutors that she set a schedule culminating in a July trial, saying at a court hearing on Friday she found the timeline unworkable. The US district judge Aileen Cannon, a Trump appointee, did not set a new trial date
